meanings.definition: A large amphitheater used for public spectacles and events, especially in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The colosseums in ancient Rome were where people gathered to watch exciting shows.
meanings.sent2: The colosseums were filled with cheering spectators during the gladiator battles.
meanings.sent3: The colosseums were so big that even the farthest seats had a good view of the action.
meanings.sent4: The colosseums stood as grand monuments to the entertainment of the ancient world.
meanings.sent5: The colosseums echoed with the sounds of cheers and clashes of swords.

meanings.sent1: We visited many colosseums during our trip to Italy.
meanings.sent2: The colosseums we saw were all impressive structures with rich histories.
meanings.sent3: The colosseums looked even more majestic under the golden sunset.
meanings.sent4: The colosseums dotted the landscape, each telling a unique story.
meanings.sent5: The colosseums' architecture varied from region to region, showcasing different styles.
